job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Kansas City, MO
pros: Research Psychiatric has a welcoming and supportive environment - I feel like a valued member of my team.  Pay is comparable to other agencies and benefits are great.  I find the work incredibly rewarding.  My immediate managers are understanding and want to see you succeed.
cons: Like all hospitals there is a huge  amount of paperwork and many tedious details to remember.  My days are very busy - fast pace, minimal downtime.  Also being at a big corporation changes are often being enforced by people who are out of touch with what the job actually entails.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Kansas City, MO
pros: The staff is super supportive especially on the senior unit. Management genuinely cares about us and is super helpful. Overall a great place to work.
cons: Of course all facilities and hospitals have their problem. Honestly the only con is just being understaffed just like everywhere else in healthcare. Truly it’s not too bad here though

job_title: Psychiatric Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros:
You can make your own schedule
decent pay and benifits
cons:
Disconnect from higher management
Ratios aren't the best ( up to 8 patients, despite being the most intense floor)

review_title: Love the work but not the benefits
job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: Most of the co-workers are great to work with on the units. Some departments have problems with people talking about other behind their backs where you don't know who you can trust. Nursing is not like that. Like working with the patients. Great pay.
cons: Poor administration decision making as no one has any understanding how to run a psychiatric hospital. Benefits are horrible and HCA should be ashamed of what they provide their employee's- being a leader in healthcare we should get the best or something that is equal to other hospitals in the Kansas City Market.

job_title: Mental Health Worker in San Antonio, TX
pros:
I have worked with psychiatric patients and found it to be very interesting work. I found that with this work I have gained insight with patients that have experienced devastating events in their life.
I have found that listening is the best way to gain the trust of the person that I am working with.
cons: The cons are that I am not alway able to reach the person the way I wish that I could.

review_title: It used to be a fantastic place to work!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Used to be such a "family" feeling, teamwork, pride in the work done.
cons: New CEO cut a lot of people and jobs and destroyed morale. No more really helping patients...just a revolving door, in and out in 3 days. Not enough staff.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: The frontline staff and middle management are exceptional, work well as a team in spite of being short staffed, under paid, and devalued at every turn.
cons: The Senior leadership has a bully, dictator mentality and blame staff for the issues instead of their own inadequacies.  The patients get no programming, the staff is overworked and frequently don't stay. The environment is negative and unhealthy for patients and staff.

job_title: Charge RN in Kansas City, MO
pros: Wages are good. Ability to trade schedules for family is nice.
cons: Poor communication between upper management and staff.

review_title: Join us At Bridges Senior Behavior Health
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Warrensburg, MO
pros: Good pay, good hrs, Great co workers and this site in Warrensburg through Research Medical Center is a great place to work! Great atmosphere!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Used to be a great team of educated employees and therapists who cared about the patients. Many treatment programs offered.
cons: Few programs for patients. Not about quality patient care. All about money. Salaries are low. Walk on eggshells. Toxic environment. 3 day stays and discharge for the patients.

job_title: Safety Coordinator in Kansas City, MO
cons: The only down about the job is money not enough
